page.title: 01WADWORTH CHURCH
page.content: Our church is 850 years old and made from local limestone. You can see the church from miles away and at night the tower is flood lit. The vicar lives in a new vicarage, the old one has become an old peoples home. There are services on Sunday and a sunday school. The vicar also looks after Loversall. At harvest time the children of the school bring some food for those who are old age pensioners. The food is taken to the old people by the infants in our school. Wadworth church needs a lot of money to hold it up. They also have funerals and people can be buried in the church yard. Every month on Sundays we have a Family Service with Guides, Brownies, Cubs Scouts and Venture Scouts and whoever wants to come. There are three groups of Sunday School,4-7s,7-10s and 10-14. Village people take the groups.
